elements.title: Ivan the Terrible (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Sergei Eisenstein's Ivan the Terrible (scene pictured) has been named as both one of the worst films and one of the greatest films of all time?

elements.title: Sydney Francisco (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Olympian Sydney Francisco was named after the city where her mother competed at the Olympics?

elements.title: December 2010 Christchurch earthquake (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the December 2010 Christchurch earthquake caused Boxing Day sales events six weeks later?

elements.title: an Ohio TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a judge compared the bankruptcy fraud of an Ohio TV station to a 1601 English court case?

elements.title: Kitab-ı Bahriye (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the surviving copies of the Kitab-ı Bahriye contain a total of more than 5,700 maps?

elements.title: I'll See You in C-U-B-A (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 1919 foxtrot song "I'll See You in C-U-B-A" was an example of Cuba being perceived as "America's playground"?

elements.title: a 1954 fire in Busan, South Korea (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that 30 royal portraits of Korean kings were completely destroyed in a 1954 fire in Busan, South Korea?

elements.title: Babydog (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Babydog is "a fixture in West Virginia politics"?
